name: Picamera
tagline: A pure Python interface to the Raspberry Pi camera module
body:
# picamera

This package provides a pure [Python](http://www.python.org/) interface to the [Raspberry Pi](http://www.raspberrypi.org/) [camera module](http://www.raspberrypi.org/camera) for Python 2.7 (or above) or Python 3.2 (or above).

## Installation

picamera is packaged in Raspbian, so install with ```apt-get```:

```apt-get install python-picamera```
or
```apt-get install python3-picamera```

Remember to run ```apt-get update``` first.

See more installation options at [ReadTheDocs](http://picamera.readthedocs.org/en/release-1.0/install2.html).

## License

The code is licensed under the [BSD license](http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause). Packages can be downloaded from the [project homepage on PyPI](http://pypi.python.org/pypi/picamera/). The [source code](https://github.com/waveform80/picamera) can be obtained from GitHub, which also hosts the [bug tracker](https://github.com/waveform80/picamera/issues). The [documentation](http://picamera.readthedocs.org/) (which includes installation, quick-start examples, and lots of code recipes) can be read on ReadTheDocs.
